sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Almost a year after his soldiers invaded Ukraine, Vladimir Putin uses his State of the Union address to claim the West started the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Three dead and hundreds injured as a new earthquake hits the same parts of Turkey and Syria where tens of thousands died two weeks ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: NATO, EU and Ukraine agree to ramp up arms productions to help Kyiv's war efforts after trilateral talks held in Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Benjamin Netanyahu's controversial plans to overhaul Israel's judiciary giving politicians more power has passed its first parliamentary vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin lashed out at the West in his state of the nation address.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: With the war in Ukraine almost a year old, the Russian president maintained that he will achieve his goals step by step, although he acknowledged that Russia is going through a difficult moment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He then made a sharp turn of reality and pointed to Western countries. The President implied there was no immediate end in sight for the conflict that began as a special military operation expected to take a week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The urgent need to get arms and ammunition to Ukraine has dominated talks between the country's foreign minister, the EU, and NATO at the military alliance's headquarters in Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The West has committed to further military aid for Ukraine, but delivery is slow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Allies announced steps to speed up the process. We have agreed that NATO should assist Ukraine to develop a procurement system that is effective, transparent and accountable.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: We have also agreed today to convene a meeting of NATO, EU and Ukrainian procurement experts to see what more we can do together to ensure Ukraine has the weapons it needs. Ukraine and its closest partners are implementing probably the largest logistical operation since the Second World War. And behind big political decisions and statements And behind big political decisions and statements, there are millions of issues that need to be resolved.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And the more coordinated we get, the sooner the Ukrainian army will kick off the Russian army from the territory of Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: With Russia pushing a new offensive in Ukraine, the NATO Secretary General also warned that Beijing could be stepping up its support for Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We are also increasingly concerned that China may be planning to provide lethal support for Russia's war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Putin must not win.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: That would show that aggression works and force is rewarded." The EU foreign policy chief, Joseph Borre, who was also in the talks, repeated that he had been assured by Beijing's top diplomat that China would not supply arms to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's lunchtime at Albina Okolova's home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The 51-year-old Ukrainian fled from Kyiv right after the Russian invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: She came to Potsdam in Germany with her mother Lyudmila and daughter Katsenia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Albina's son Danilo is also in Potsdam. He's been living and studying here since 2020.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Albina is relieved to be now reunited with her family and also thankful for being able to live in peace in Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: I came here in a sports suit and with 200 euros in my pocket.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: And now I am calm that my daughter is studying.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: I have the opportunity to study and then work.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's not the first time that Albina has had to start over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Until 2015, she used to live and work as a doctor in Crimea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: After the Russian annexation, she fled to Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Her 15-year-old daughter now goes to a so-called welcome class in Potsdam. Yes, it's hard because I'm in a new situation, in a new country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's hard, but I can do it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Albina is driving to a governmental office in Potsdam where she needs to apply for German classes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: She wants to learn the language as soon as possible to be able to work as a doctor again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: It's difficult because the bureaucracy takes a lot of time, a thing most Ukrainians in Germany struggle with, she says. I can't be calm because I have to do some papers that end at the end of the year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And I don't have any peace to do the training and upbringing of my daughter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Over a million Ukrainians have come to Germany as refugees since the war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And although government support is now working better, there are still major challenges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The main problem is a shortage of housing, especially in major cities like Berlin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But there are many other problems, according to the VYCHA organization, a Berlin-based association that, among other things, provides assistance to Ukrainian refugees. zu der VITCHA-Organisation, einer berlin-basierten Organisation, die unter anderem Unterstützung an ukrainische Flüchtlinge bietet.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ähnlich ist es zum Beispiel auch mit der Jobsuche, den Schulplätzen und den Kita-Plätzen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Wenn es keine Kita-Plätze gibt, dann können die Mütter zum Beispiel nicht in die Integrationskurse und nicht in die Sprachkurse gehen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Und dann ist das natürlich auch schwierig mit der Jobsuche danach, weil in vielen Bereichen braucht man halt die deutsche Sprache. Although she worries about and misses her relatives in Ukraine, she's happy to have a roof over her head in Germany and thankful she was reunited with her family in a safe place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Panic in Hatay province in southern Turkey as another earthquake strikes the region

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: that was devastated two weeks ago, destroying fragile buildings, trapping more people inside.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This time it was a 6.4 magnitude tremor, at least three people are reported to have died, with another 213 injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Turkish authorities have recorded more than 6,000 aftershocks since the February 6 earthquake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This one was the strongest so far I had never seen such a big earthquake before. I came to the Patelvan with the Turkish Green Party.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We are helping the victims of the earthquake at the disaster coordination centre.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: We have understood their psychology a little bit because it is an incredibly terrifying moment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Rebel-held parts of Syria were also hit by the new earthquake. Search and rescue services and the Syrian Civil Defense, known as the White Helmets, REBEL-HELD PARTS OF SYRIA WERE ALSO HIT BY THE NEW EARTHQUAKE.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: SEARCH AND RESCUE SERVICES AND THE SYRIAN CIVIL DEFENSE, KNOWN AS THE WHITE HELMETS, REPORTED THE LATEST TREMOR HAD DAMAGED BUILDINGS ACROSS A NUMBER OF CITIES AND TOWNS.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: THEY SAID PEOPLE HAD BEEN INJURED BY FALLING DEBRIS, AS WELL AS FROM JUMPING FROM ELEVATED POSITIONS IN FEAR OF MORE DESTRUCTION. nations in fear of more destruction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government's plans to overhaul the country's legal system passed their first hurdle despite uproar among many Israelis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The 63-47 Knesset vote after midnight gave initial approval to a plan that will give Netanyahu's coalition more power over who becomes a judge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's part of a broader package of changes that seeks to weaken the country's supreme court and transfer more power to the ruling coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The legislators cast their votes after a vitriolic debate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: During the session, opposition lawmakers chanted shame and wrapped themselves in the Israeli flag, and some were ejected from the hall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Thousands of protesters have staged rallies objecting to the move.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Netanyahu's ultra-religious and ultra-nationalist allies say these changes are needed to rein in the powers of an unelected judiciary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Critics fear the judges will be appointed based on loyalty to the government or prime minister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The vote's just the first of three readings required for parliamentary approval, a process that is expected to take months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad has made his first official trip to Oman in more than a decade of civil war at home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The one-day visit to meet Sultan Haytham bin Tarek comes two weeks after twin earthquakes struck southeastern Turkey and northern Syria, killing more than 44,000 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The natural disaster has sparked a modicum of reaching out from Arab countries to the internationally isolated Assad government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: European heavyweights Liverpool and Real Madrid will lock horns in the Champions League last 16

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: in a repeat of last season's final. Back in May, Mo Salah's teammates failed to deliver in Paris and were eventually denied a seventh European title.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: With many players injured, their manager Jürgen Klopp knows they'll have to perform at their very best if they want to go through.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: We need to be two super games to be honest to get through, but I have no problem with that because if you don't play your best, you don't have a chance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Real Madrid doesn't have to play their best and still have a chance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And that's the difference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And that's pretty special.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: But I can't wait.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: After a relatively slow start to the season, Karim Benzema's teammates have added another club World Cup title to their trophy cabinets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The French international and Ballon d'Or winner will be part of the squad, but his compatriot Aurélien Tramini and Toni Kroos will both miss out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Liverpool have lost their last six games against Real, the longest ever streak without success against a single opponent in the Champions League.
